chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M. Schoolmaster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Stayed Sentences on Ct 1 and Ct 2 in this same case are concurrent to each other and consecutive to the stayed sentence on Ct 1 in case 15CF67
Consecutive to: Extended Supervision is concurrent to Ct 2 in this same case and consecutive to Ct 1 on case 15CF67
Concurrent with: Probation on Ct 2 in this same case and to probation on Ct 1 in case 15CF67 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Restitution is joint and several with co-defendants if and when convicted.

Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.  Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.
Defendant shall remain employed and if not he is to job searches as instructed by his agent.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request  Defendant is to undergo a psychological evaluation and follow all recommendations, releasing all to his agent.

The defendant shall have no contact with Travis Spinler, Ivana Green or Ashley McGargill  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.   Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.
AMENDED 07/17/2019 No contact with Ashley McGargill is lifted if written approval by the supervising agent is received by the Court.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer, which should be done at least monthly.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

timeConds.notes: Huber granted.  defendant was granted 239 days credit for time served.  Jail sentence is on Ct 1 only.
